title: Differently-abled student allotted exam hall on first floor allowed to take test on ground floor from second day
content: When a video of the woman carrying her daughter to the first floor surfaced on social media on Tuesday, HRD Minister N. Lokesh took to X to apologise to all the specially-abled students who faced such inconvenience and instructed officials to ensure the problem doesn’t repeat

title: The Hindu journalists feted at 2025 Ramnath Goenka awards
content: Maitri Porecha and Satyasundar Barik of The Hindu were felicitated for their work on the Balasore railway tragedy and human trafficking in Odisha’s border villages respectively

title: Technology an enabler, but boots on ground can’t be replaced: CDS
content: Chief of Defence Staff emphasises boots on the ground over technology; lessons learned in hybrid warfare at Raisina Dialogue

title: Child welfare council’s Kilikoottam summer camp from April 3
content: Two-month long camp, concluding on May 25, aims to make the summer holidays a fun and engaging experience for children

title: Union Cabinet revamps dairy sector scheme; allocates ₹1,000 crore for development
content: The scheme has two key components, including the measures for improving essential dairy infrastructure, such as milk chilling plants, advanced milk testing laboratories, and certification systems

title: Doubling airline capacity on India-UAE routes will help Indian consumers save $1.05 billion: report
content: The report is jointly released by ORF and the UAE embassy when there is a tug of war between Air India and Gulf carriers over international passenger traffic

title: LDF loses power in Thodupuzha municipality after UDF no-trust motion sails through
content: The no-trust motion gets the support of 18 members, including four Bharatiya Janata Party councillors, while 12 vote against it

title: Kerala needs to focus on iconic tourism destinations: Union Minister
content: State has been in the forefront of attracting tourists by introducing novel products and it should continue to do so, says Gajendra Singh Shekhawat

title: Karnataka HC issues notice to Centre on plea by Ranya Rao’s mother to lay down guidelines for media
content: Ranya’s mother Rohini and stepfather Ramachandra Rao alleged that media houses are continuing defamatory news despite restraint orders passed by the courts

title: CRDA Commissioner authorised to approve L1 bids for 22 works in Amaravati costing ₹22,608 crore
content: Resolutions accepting the lowest bids for the works were passed by the CRDA in its meeting on March 11

title: Karnataka Assembly adopts resolutions urging Centre to withdraw Waqf Amendment Bill, new UGC regulations
content: ‘Proposed amendments aimed at curtailing the powers of States with respect to waqf, besides being opposed to the secular principles enshrined in the Constitution’

title: Over 2.40 lakh students to appear for SSLC examination in Kittur Karnataka region
content: As many as 773 exam centres have been set up across the nine educational districts of the region for the exam starting tomorrow

title: Questions proposed for Calicut varsity Senate meeting rejected, claims pro-Left member
content: It is an attempt to conceal key facts from the Senate, the supreme authority of the university, alleges the member

title: Rajouri deaths: Opposition demands CBI probe, J&K Government says insecticide contamination being probed
content: The government said forensic analysis by the Central Forensic Science Laboratory in Chandigarh detected chlorfenapyr, an insecticide, in the viscera samples of all 17 deceased individuals

title: Minister alerts Nellore farmers to remove middlemen
content: Instead of getting deceived by the middlemen, Nadendla Manohar asks the farmers to sell their paddy for minimum support price at government-established procurement centres and receive money within 24 hours

title: Film society calls for drug-free cinema
content: The society paid tributes to the memory of scriptwriter Sreevaraham Balakrishnan, lyricist Mankombu Gopalakrishnan, and social activists K.K. Kochu and A.K. Puthussery

title: Wife watching porn privately, indulging in self-pleasure is not cruelty on husband: Madras High Court
content: The Madurai Bench of the High Court dismisses appeal and says the contours of spousal privacy will include various aspects of a woman’s sexual autonomy

title: Learn Vedas along with modern education, say scholars
content: The three-day South India ‘Kshetriya Vedic Sammelan’ hosted by SVVU was attended by 100 Vedic scholars from across Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu and Kerala

title: WCD department readies action plan to improve nutritional status of children
content: Plan to train at least one nurse from Gynaecology department of hospitals as lactation counsellor to encourage women to breastfeed their newborns. They will also be trained in neonatal care. Initiative to be piloted in Thiruvananthapuram

title: IndiGo to get A321 XLR deliveries from FY2026
content: Athens, Geneva among possible destinations that could help strengthen IndiGo’s foray into Europe from this July

title: House panel asks govt. to pursue centralisation of Eklavya schools, notes slow progress of PVTG scheme, tribal freedom fighter museums
content: The PM-JANMAN package for basic scheme saturate has been completed in 4,288 villages out of the target of 29,000

title: Kerala sees trend of increasing summer rain fuelled by rise in average temperature
content: For every 1 °C increase in temperature, the atmosphere can hold approximately 7% more water in the form of vapour, leading to intense spells during the summer, says expert

title: Bengaluru set to celebrate the convergence of Earth Hour and UN World Water Day on March 22
content: This year, Dia Mirza, Viswanathan Anand, Ranveer Brar, Sudarsan Pattnaik, Shantanu Moitra, Taba Chake and Ricky Kej are voicing their support for celebrating the Biggest Hour for Earth

title: Prakasam district’s ‘Bangaru Balyam’ initiative bags SKOCH Award
content: District administration won the award for their effort in preventing child marriages and bonded labour after a thorough selection process that included presentation, public opinion, and expert voting

title: Grabbing breasts, breaking pyjama string is not enough for charge of attempt to rape, says Allahabad High Court
content: The Court orders modification in the charges slapped by a lower court against two men accused of these actions.

title: ED filed 193 cases against serving, ex-politicians, secured two convictions: Government informs parliament
content: According to the data, the maximum number of 32 cases against former and serving legislators were filed by the ED during the 2022-23 fiscal

title: New Bihar Congress chief hopes to revive party ahead of upcoming Assembly election
content: Rajesh Kumar, son of veteran Congress leader Dilkeshwar Ram, was made the new chief of the Bihar Pradesh Congress Committee

title: Tamil Nadu govt., Tasmac move Madras High Court against ED searches
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and N. Senthilkumar agree to hear their writ petitions on Thursday

title: GoM decides to constitute district-level committees in Andhra Pradesh to address land-related concerns
content: Irregularities committed by the previous YSRCP government in the allocation of land under housing-for-all scheme will be investigated, says Revenue Minister Satya Prasad

title: Not a single CBI special court functional in West Bengal: Amit Shah in Rajya Sabha
content: Shah was responding to Trinamool Congress member Saket Gokhale’s remarks on the track record of the CBI as “over 6,900 cases” were pending trial

title: ED attaches properties worth ₹1.76 crore in Punjab National Bank case in U.P.
content: The properties attached are in the form of agriculture land, house and flat situated at Kanpur, Fatehpur, Gorakhpur and Varanasi

title: Allocations to madrasa and waqf educational schemes slashed almost to nil in 2024-25
content: The Centre’s reply to Trinamool MP Derek O’Brien’s query in Rajya Sabha showed a drop from ₹174 crore to nil in the past four years

title: SSC exams conducted smoothly in Anantapur, Chittoor and Kurnool districts
content: Of the 135 examination centres in Anantapur district, 30,537 students attended it while 325 were absent, says Collector

title: Talks fail, ASHAs to go on hunger strike from Thursday
content: Two rounds of discussions with National Health Mission authorities as well as the Health Minister fail to resolve the stalemate.  ASHAs, under the banner of Kerala ASHA Health Workers’ Association, have been resolute in their demand that they have to be paid an honorarium of ₹21,000 and that they be provided a retirement benefit of ₹5 lakh when they leave the profession

title: Lions propose significant playoff seeding change
content: The Lions have proposed a significant change to NFL playoff seeding that would largely use regular-season records as the guiding principle.

title: Sources: Vikes to roll with McCarthy, not Rodgers
content: The Vikings are moving past their discussions with free agent quarterback Aaron Rodgers, leaving second-year player J.J. McCarthy atop the quarterback depth chart as offseason practices approach, sources told ESPN.

title: JuJu, Hidalgo lead women's AP All-America team
content: USC's JuJu Watkins and Hannah Hidalgo of Notre Dame have joined an elite group, making the Associated Press All-America team in their first two seasons playing college basketball.

title: NHL 'reevaluating' ASG after 4 Nations success
content: Following the runaway success of last month's 4 Nations Face-Off, which replaced the NHL's traditional All-Star Game, the league is prepared to roll out something entirely different again in February 2026.

title: Pro-rel coming to U.S. soccer for 1st time in USL
content: United Soccer League (USL) club owners voted on Wednesday for a promotion and relegation system, marking the first time the European-style system would be implemented in the United States.

title: Draymond: '1 million percent' have case for DPOY
content: After a defensive gem that held Giannis Antetokounmpo to 5-of-16 shooting -- the Bucks star's worst shooting game in the past two seasons -- the Warriors' Draymond Green outlined his case for a second Defensive Player of the Year award.

title: Sources: Clemson, Brownell finalizing new deal
content: Clemson is finalizing a new six-year deal for men's basketball coach Brad Brownell that will keep him at the school through 2031, sources tell ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: Defense department pulls Jackie Robinson story
content: The Department of Defense deleted a story on its website that highlighted Jackie Robinson's military service, with the original URL redirecting to one that added the letters "dei" in front of "sports-heroes."

title: Free agency in review: Additions, subtractions and the current state of all 32 teams
content: Following the first week of free agency, we're taking inventory on every NFL team and whom they've signed.

title: On Dodgers' Japan trip, Shohei Ohtani is everywhere and nowhere
content: The star is omnipresent in ads across his home country, but fan fervor keeps the real Ohtani out of sight.

title: Did the Luka trade actually make the Lakers' defense better? Inside L.A.'s elite run
content: The Lakers, with Doncic and 40-year-old LeBron James, are suddenly one of the NBA's top defenses. Will it stay that way?

content: Amid changes and dire predictions about college hoops, top coaches in the game seem to have figured it out.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: Source: Amorim to make call on Sancho future
content: Manchester United will let Ruben Amorim decide Jadon Sancho's future in the unlikely event that the England forward returns to Old Trafford, a source has told ESPN.

title: Poch: 'Big mistake' for USMNT to focus on politics
content: U.S. men's national team coach Mauricio Pochettino dismissed the political overtones surrounding the Concacaf Nations League finals, calling it a "big mistake" for his team to discuss politics.

title: Rangers tell fans: Join 'progressive' club or leave
content: Rangers have urged fans to help the club remain a "modern, progessive" and inclusive, adding that any supporter who doesn't want that should "disassociate" themselves immediately.

title: Núñez on goal drought: Bad luck, but won't give up

title: Farm Leaders Detained In Punjab's Mohali, Cops Clean Up Shambhu Border
content: A group of farmer leaders were detained by the Punjab police when they were on their way to join the ongoing farmers' protest at the Shambhu and Khanauri borders. Those detained included Sarwan Singh Pandher and Jagjit Singh Dallewal.

title: For Husband's Murder, She Sent Lover Snapchat Messages Posing As Dead Mother
content: The grisly murder of a Merchant Navy officer in Meerut, whose body was chopped up and dumped in a drum, was planned by his wife, who convinced her boyfriend that his mother was speaking to him - through Snapchat - from beyond the grave.

title: "Taiyyar Raho": 100 Lawyers Try To Attack Cement Murder Accused In UP Court
content: The woman and her boyfriend accused of stabbing her Merchant Navy officer husband and chopping up his body found themselves at the receiving end of the ire of over 100 lawyers when they were produced in a court in Meerut on Wednesday.

title: 28,000 Kmph, 1,600 Degrees: Fireball Test Before Sunita Williams Landed
content: A Dragon spacecraft bringing astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore home after nine months in space splashed down off the coast of Florida at 3.30 am IST.

title: Live: 45-Day Rehabilitation For Astronaut; "Earth Missed You", Says PM Modi
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, after an unexpected stay at the International Space Station (ISS) for more than nine months, have returned to Earth and splashed down off the coast of the American state of Florida early on Wednesday.

title: "He Loved Blindly, Our Daughter Was Problem": Murdered Meerut Man's In-Laws
content: The parents of Muskaan Rastogi, arrested for allegedly murdering Merchant Navy officer Saurabh Rajput with her lover's help, want her to be hanged till death and stress that they are firmly with Saurabh's family in their fight for justice.

title: Merchant Navy Officer's WhatsApp Chat With Sister, Days After His Murder
content: On March 6, Merchant Navy officer Saurabh Rajput's sister Chinki got a WhatsApp message from his number, asking if she would be in Meerut for Holi. She replied yes. Another message said he was away and would only return after Holi

title: Sunita Williams Smiles, Waves As She Returns Home After 286 Days In Space
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore have returned home after their eight-day mission to the International Space Station turned into a nine-month-long stay.

title: After Quad, India May Be Part Of New Military Grouping In South China Sea
content: Even as the Quad steadily strengthens its hold across the Indo-Pacific region, India may soon consider being a part of another key multilateral alliance that focuses on the South China Sea.

title: UP Woman's 2 Boyfriends, A Love Triangle And A Murder On Camera
content: She called her boyfriend to meet on the night of Holi last week. The woman promised to marry him but little did he know that his girlfriend had planned his murder with her new boyfriend.

title: "One Of The Nastiest Countries": Trump Amid Trade War With "51st State" Canada
content: Speaking to Fox News, answering why he is tougher with Canada than other big adversaries, he said, "I deal with every country, indirectly or directly. One of the nastiest countries to deal with is Canada".

title: Punjab deploys 3,000 cops, JCBs to evict farmers from protest sites; top leaders held
content: Punjab Police dismantled temporary structures and detained several farmer leaders protesting at the Punjab-Haryana border over various demands. Punjab minister Harpal Singh Cheema justified the action for reopening borders, while both Congress and Akali Dal leaders criticized the government's approach. Next round of talks is set for May 4.

title: Tesla trouble: Once an icon for libs, Musk vehicles now a hated MAGA symbol
content: Tesla faces attacks in the US, including vandalism and arson on vehicles and showrooms, prompting the Trump administration to label these as acts of domestic terrorism. Despite founder Elon Musk's defense, the company sees declining sales in Europe due to backlash against Musk's behavior. Meanwhile, Chinese company BYD introduces a faster-charging system, increasing competition.

title: Tharoor's praise for PM: Wiping egg off his face or leaving Cong red-faced?
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's recent praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi has caused embarrassment within his party, prompting the BJP to mock Congress leadership. Tharoor has reiterated PM Modi's stance on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, raising concerns about his intentions and internal party dynamics ahead of the Kerala assembly elections.

title: 'My parents left me to die': First Indian to win UFC fight Puja Tomar
content: Puja Tomar, from Budhana village in Uttar Pradesh, became the first Indian woman to win a UFC bout. Her victory over Brazil’s Rayanne Amanda dos Santos was not just a personal triumph but a significant achievement for India. Despite a difficult upbringing, she proved that girls are not a burden and made her village proud.

title: Elon Musk names Jeff Bezos & Google, Oracle founders as smartest people he knows
content: Elon Musk praised several tech leaders including Larry Ellison, Larry Page, and Jeff Bezos for their intelligence and achievements. Despite Musk and Bezos' past rivalry, their relationship appears to be improving, notably highlighted by Musk's recent memes suggesting reconciliation.

title: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee receives signed jersey from Lionel Messi
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee received a jersey signed by football legend Lionel Messi. Celebrating the gift, she highlighted Bengal's deep-rooted passion for football and mentioned previous visits by global football icons, including Ronaldinho. Additionally, an agreement to establish a football academy in West Bengal was mentioned.

title: JP Morgan CEO to Stanford University students: I don’t defend your right to...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has mandated five days of office work starting this month, asserting it is the best way to run the company. Dimon highlighted the importance of in-person work for learning, innovation, and company culture, emphasizing its criticality for younger employees and managerial communication.

title: Chhetri scores on comeback as India beat Maldives 3-0
content: Sunil Chhetri returned to the national team, scoring his 95th international goal, leading India to a 3-0 victory over Maldives in a friendly match. This win ended India's 12-match winless streak, setting a positive tone for the upcoming AFC Asian Cup qualifier against Bangladesh. The match also marked the first win under head coach Manolo Marquez.

title: 'Cold-blooded murder': Priyanka Gandhi flays Israel over Gaza strikes
content: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised the Israeli government for the "cold-blooded murder" of over 400 Palestinian civilians, including children, emphasizing that such acts reveal their inhumanity. She condemned Israel's recent airstrikes in Gaza, praised the resilience of the Palestinian people, and called for global acknowledgment of the oppression Palestinians face.

content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Ben Stiller, Paul McCartney, 400-plus stars urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, have signed an open letter to the Trump administration opposing efforts to weaken copyright protections for AI training. They argue such changes would harm the creative industry, which supports millions of American jobs and significant economic contributions.

title: BCCI considers lifting saliva ban ahead of IPL 2025
content: The BCCI is thinking about allowing players to use saliva on the ball again during the IPL. The proposal will be discussed with IPL team captains. The ICC had banned the practice due to COVID-19. The IPL may also approve the use of DRS for height wides and wides outside the off-stump.

title: Watch: Dravid spotted on electric wheelchair ahead of IPL 2025
content: Rajasthan Royals' head coach Rahul Dravid, despite sustaining a leg injury, continues to lead his team from an electric wheelchair. Dravid, injured during a local cricket match, remains actively involved in training sessions, demonstrating remarkable determination. His commitment is appreciated widely, as the Royals prepare for the upcoming IPL 2025 season opener against Sunrisers Hyderabad on March 23.

title: Algerian boxer Khelif 'not intimidated' by Trump
content: Algerian Olympic boxer Imane Khelif, who was embroiled in a gender controversy during the Paris Games, aims for a second gold medal in Los Angeles, dismissing Donald Trump's policy on transgender athletes. Khelif refutes claims she's transgender, asserting her determination to continue competing. Last month, the US president signed an executive order preventing transgender women from competing in female sports categories. Trump had previously claimed that the 25-year-old boxer had transitioned from male to female, which Khelif has strongly refuted.

title: Chicken legs: After 9 months in space, Sunita faces many challenges
content: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams returned to Earth after an extended nine-month stay in space, experiencing various physiological changes due to the absence of gravity. They are undergoing rehabilitation exercises to restore their health, and post-landing procedures include medical supervision and monitoring at Johnson Space Center.

title: 'At 43, MS Dhoni has the fastest hands as a wicketkeeper'
content: MS Dhoni may bat at No. 7 or No. 8 in the upcoming IPL, showcasing his skills in limited deliveries. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma also return to T20 cricket. New captains Axar Patel and Rajat Patidar face challenges leading their respective franchises in high-scoring venues. At 43, Dhoni has shown no signs of slowing down, proving his readiness for IPL 2025 during a CSK net session on Tuesday. In a display of his signature power-hitting, he launched a searing yorker from Matheesha Pathirana over the bowler’s head with his trademark helicopter shot.

title: How scientists became propagandists during Covid-19
content: But the Times is just a symptom of a larger problem. The Covid-19 pandemic wasn’t just a public health crisis; it was a stress test for science itself. And, as we now know, science failed. The very principles that were supposed to safeguard scientific integrity—those outlined decades ago by sociologist Robert K. Merton—were casually tossed aside whenever they became inconvenient.

title: 'Stay on right side ….': EAM on 'weaponisation' of social media, telecom
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has highlighted that trade between major economies now considers national security, trust, and comfort over just cost. He noted that tariffs and sanctions are increasingly used to protect economic interests.

title: 'Aurangzeb not relevant today': RSS on Nagpur riots
content: The RSS has distanced itself from the controversy over demands to demolish Aurangzeb's tomb in Khultabad. Recent violent clashes between groups resulted in curfews being imposed. Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis warned against glorifying Aurangzeb, citing the unrest and the impact of a related film.

title: '1,000 Hindus still missing': Akhilesh Yadav's big claim on Maha Kumbh
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has expressed concerns over the arrangements at the Maha Kumbh event and accused the BJP government of not doing enough to find nearly 1,000 missing Hindus. He also criticized the handling of the gathering by the Uttar Pradesh officials and questioned the allocation of funds for the event.

title: Preparing for space war? 5 Chinese satellites spotted 'dogfighting'
content: The US Space Force highlighted that China is developing space combat capabilities, with five Chinese satellites executing synchronised movements likened to orbital dogfighting. Verification confirmed involvement of specific satellites, underscoring growing threats and the need for enhanced US defenses as the technological gap narrows.

title: Acknowledge resentment, but current policy on tours will remain intact: BCCI
content: BCCI remains firm on its new policy for player's families during overseas tours despite senior players' reservations. The policy, active for decades with recent amendments, allows family presence for two weeks on tours over 45 days. It also mandates contracted players to participate in domestic cricket when available, aiming to enhance team unity and player development.

title: Nagpur violence: Police arrest 8 VHP, Bajrang Dal workers
content: Eight VHP and Bajrang Dal workers surrendered to Kotwali police in connection with recent violence in Nagpur. Clashes erupted over protests demanding the removal of Aurangzeb's tomb, resulting in injuries to police and widespread property damage. Police arrested at least 50 rioters and imposed curfew in several areas.

title: 'Rs 7 crore bribe': ACB books ex-AAP minister in CCTV project case
content: Delhi's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) has taken legal action against AAP leader Satyendra Jain for alleged corruption in a Rs 571 crore CCTV project. Jain is accused of waiving Rs 16 crore in penalties for Bharat Electronics Limited in exchange for a Rs 7 crore bribe. The project faced repeated delays and issues with camera functionality.

title: Joe Burrow’s heartwarming moment with Ja’Marr Chase & Tee Higgins
content: Cincinnati Bengals have secured their future by extending contracts for wide receivers Ja’Marr Chase and Tee Higgins, ensuring stability alongside quarterback Joe Burrow. With these key players locked in, the team aims for a Super Bowl win. However, maintaining a strong offensive line and solid defense remains crucial for achieving their ultimate goal.

title: Tax-saving fixed deposits with high interest rates - check list
content: With the financial year ending soon, many rush to maximize tax-saving investments. Among the options, Tax-Saving Fixed Deposits (FDs) offer secure returns and tax benefits under Section 80C. However, these deposits have a five-year lock-in period and their interest income is taxable.

title: IPL 2025: Delhi Capitals Team Preview – SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Delhi Capitals enter IPL 2025 with Axar Patel as the new captain, featuring star signings like KL Rahul and Mitchell Starc. The team aims to secure their first IPL title with a powerful batting lineup and a robust pace attack, despite some spin department concerns. TimesofIndia.com presents a SWOT analysis of Delhi Capitals ahead of IPL 2025.

title: Watch: Canada's 'rage room' lets customers smash Trump, Vance portraits
content: Rage Room: Halifax in Nova Scotia offers an outlet for frustration over Trump's tariffs by allowing customers to destroy portraits of Trump for free. This initiative is aimed at helping people relieve stress by offering political-themed items to break while contributing to a local food bank.

title: Did Kamala Harris lose to Donald Trump because of TikTok?
content: A recent report by Blue Rose Research, led by Democratic data scientist David Shor, found that Harris suffered substantial losses among young and politically disengaged voters, a demographic that had previously leaned Democratic. The study suggests that TikTok, a platform known for shaping political discourse among Gen Z, may have contributed to shifting political attitudes, particularly among young men.

title: Leaking secrets to Pak: UP arrests another ordnance factory employee
content: The Uttar Pradesh ATS has arrested Kumar Vikas from the Kanpur Ordnance Factory for allegedly leaking sensitive information to a suspected Pakistani agent, Neha Sharma. This incident, involving misuse of social media and encrypted communication platforms, poses a significant threat to national security.

title: Merchant navy officer killed after UK return: Wife, lover dismember body
content: A 35-year-old merchant navy officer from London was murdered by his estranged wife and her lover in Meerut. The victim’s dismembered body was sealed in a cement-filled drum, discovered nearly 15 days later. Police arrested the culprits, who tried to cover up the crime by misleading the victim's family.

title: ‘India somewhat insulated…’: Fitch on US tariffs
content: India's economy is expected to grow 6.5% in FY26, slightly slowing in FY27 to 6.3%. Fitch highlights India's relative insulation from US trade policies due to low external demand.

title: 'Strangled with nebuliser pipe': Elderly couple murdered in Delhi
content: An elderly couple in Pitampura, Delhi, was found murdered in their home by a night attendant only employed for two days. The killer left the area undetected, leading the community to reassess security measures. The crime has deeply shocked family members and local residents.

title: With Rs 65 crore each, Andhra MLAs have largest assets nationwide
content: Andhra Pradesh MLAs possess the highest average assets in India, approximately Rs 65.07 crore, with seven ranking among the top 20 wealthiest legislators nationally. Notably, 79% of Andhra Pradesh MLAs have declared criminal cases, the highest percentage among all states.

title: Nagpur violence: 15-year-old attacked IPS Kadam with axe
content: A 15-year-old boy attacked Zonal DCP Niketan Kadam with an axe during riots at Hansapuri, aiming for his neck. Kadam blocked the blow with his hand, sustaining serious injuries. He underwent emergency surgery and is currently recovering. The officer and 11 other personnel were injured while trapped by a mob and subsequently rescued by reinforcements.

title: Bill Gates meets JP Nadda in Parliament, discusses healthcare progress
content: Bill Gates, former Microsoft CEO, discussed India's healthcare advancements with Union minister JP Nadda. Key areas included maternal health, immunisation, and sanitation. Gates praised India's efforts in medical cost reduction and accessible healthcare solutions globally, highlighting AI's role in future collaboration with the India AI Mission.

title: Farmer leaders Dallewal, Pandher detained in Mohali
content: Neel Kamal writes about sustainable agriculture, environment, climate change for The Times of India. His incisive and comprehensive reporting about over a year-long farmers' struggle against farm laws at the borders of the national capital won laurels. He is an alumunus of Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology.
